oai_dc:dc.dc:title: McKenzie Depot: exterior with overhanging eave
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of the facade of the brick depot, with two narrow nine-over-one windows under a wide overhanging corner eve supported by ornate scroll-sawn brackets.

The McKenzie Depot is a Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway Passenger Station (N.C.&St.L.) . It is a small town depot designed to accomodate the growing needs for railroad transportation. The town of McKenzie was organized and platted in 1865 around the railroad. The last passenger train stopped in the town in 1970.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Railroad stations -- Tennessee
Railroad stations
